Dear women! Here are the announcements for the upcoming week. üîπWednesday, December 4, 2024 18:00 Ukrainian House, ul. Zamenhofa, 1 Psychological workshop with body practices. Led by psychotherapist Tetyana Moiseeva. Holidays, including Christmas, which for many centuries has been a holiday of faith and hope, are just around the corner. However, maybe instead of joy you feel entirely different emotions? You might want to celebrate, but... where is that festive mood? This is normal, especially in such a complicated time. During the workshop, we will talk about how to cope with anxiety, fatigue, or perhaps, guilt. We will create a cozy space for dialogue, practices of psycho-emotional self-regulation and support. We will also talk about how to allow yourself to truly rejoice and relax and what valuable things this can bring not only to us but to our loved ones. Since all workshops conducted by Tetyana Moiseeva are interactive, for your comfort, it is better to come in comfortable clothing. Participation of children or men is not anticipated. Expected duration of the meeting is 2 hours. The number of places is limited. Registration at the link:

üîπFriday, December 6, 2024 10:00 am House of Culture Kadr, ul. Wincentego Rzymowskiego, 32 (Warsaw).

Workshop on self-massage of the neck and d√©colletage area with elements of posture exercises. Led by professional cosmetologist Tetyana Tkachenko. In the workshop, massage techniques will focus on the neck and d√©colletage area plus exercises for good posture. Such massage combined with appropriate exercises positively affects the circulatory and lymphatic systems, enhances collagen production, increases muscle and skin tone, and contributes to improving the psycho-emotional state. For convenience, please wear clothes with an open neck and d√©colletage, and have a hair tie or clip to gather your hair. Attention! Professional cosmetics with vitamin C will be used in the workshop. If you have sensitive skin, you can bring your own cosmetics. Be responsible in taking part in the workshop if you are prone to allergic reactions. Participation of children or men is not provided for. The expected duration of the meeting is 2 hours. Number of places is limited. Registration link:

üîπSaturday, December 7, 2024 10:00 a.m. Solec 38, Warsaw (landmark cafe The Cool Cat) Pilates training. Led by certified trainer, group program instructor Inna Datsenko. Pilates is one of the safest types of training, which includes a set of exercises for the whole body, developing flexibility and mobility. It is a conscious work with all muscle groups, the spine, and breathing. Pilates has a good effect not only on physical fitness but also on emotional state! In Pilates, all exercises are done slowly and smoothly, without sudden movements. That is why such physical exercises are suitable for participants of any age and fitness level! Please do not be late and come in advance at 9:45 a.m. For training, you need to have comfortable sportswear, sports shoes, and water, as well as a mat/rug. Participation of children and men is not provided. Childcare is not available! The duration of the session is 1 hour. The number of spots is limited. Registration via link:

üîπSunday, December 8, 2024 11:00 AM Ukrainian House, ul. Zamenhofa, 1

Practical psychological masterclass "First Dates: Psychology of Choice and Interaction"
Conducted by - psychologist-sexologist, consultant in methods of transactional analysis and systemic-family psychotherapy Yulia Kvasnytsia.
Do you want to feel more confident on a first date and in general when choosing a partner? Not sure how to recognize "red flags" in a potential partner's behavior? Interested in how to communicate correctly and assess the dynamics of relationships?
In the masterclass we will:
- highlight key moments of the first date;
- provide tools for analyzing the partner's behavior;
- help understand cultural peculiarities if the partner is a foreigner;
- conduct an interactive exercise in the format of "speed dating" to learn how to recognize important details in dialogue.
What will you get? Practical techniques for working on your expectations and boundaries.
Analytical exercises for deep understanding of yourself and your behavior.
Opportunity to practice communication skills in a safe space.
Expected duration of the meeting - 2 hours.
Participation of children and men is not foreseen. Childcare option - not available.
Number of places is limited.
Registration via the link:

How to buy a house in Poland?
What documents are needed?

To obtain permission, you need to submit:
‚úÖ An application with the purpose of purchase.
‚úÖ A copy of the passport.
‚úÖ Documents confirming the connection with Poland (for example, a residence permit).
‚úÖ A certificate from the seller about the sale of real estate.
‚úÖ An extract from the cadastral register of the land plot.
‚úÖ A certificate of financial capability.
Application review process

The Ministry of Internal Affairs and Administration of Poland considers the application within two months. During this process, the authorities verify several important aspects: üëâ Your connection with Poland. Do you have a residence permit, work permit, or other significant reasons for acquiring real estate. üëâ Purpose of acquisition. The Ministry assesses whether the purchase meets your residential or business needs, and whether it poses a threat to the country's security and economy. üëâ Threat to national security. It is checked whether the purchase poses risks to national security or the strategic interests of Poland. If all conditions are met and there are no risks, the permit will be issued. In case of refusal, there is an option to appeal the decision in an administrative court. üü¢ If you have additional questions, please contact our hotline at the number: ‚òé

Income verification in the rental market in Poland: what do tenants need to know?

If you are looking for an apartment to rent in Poland, you may encounter the landlord asking you to confirm your income. This might seem a bit unusual, but actually, it is a standard procedure that helps all market participants feel safer.
Why are landlords interested in your income?
Warranty for the owner.
Income verification is a way to make sure you can pay rent regularly. The landlord wants to be sure you are a reliable tenant.
Protection for you.
Providing information about income helps to conclude a deal faster and avoid misunderstandings in the future. You show that you have a stable financial position, and this strengthens trust.
How does it work?
Don't worry, income verification is a simple process. Here's what they might ask for: ‚úÖ
Certificate of employment
or a bank statement. You just show that you have a stable income.
employment contract
or a bank statement.
tax declaration or other documents
that show your income.
What to do if incomes are unstable?

If your income is not very stable, it's not a problem either. Some landlords may accept a higher deposit (kaucja) or may offer alternative options for a guarantee (for example, involving a guarantor).

and it is aimed at making both parties feel confident. It is not difficult, and if you have a stable income, then there is nothing to worry about! üü¢ If you have additional questions - contact our hotline, at the number: ‚òé

Buying an apartment in Poland for Ukrainian citizens in 2024: key aspects

In 2024, citizens of Ukraine have the opportunity to purchase real estate in Poland, considering several important aspects. Let's examine the conditions and procedures that need to be known before making a decision.
Right to purchase
Accessibility for Ukrainian citizens: In 2024

However, if the property is to be used for conducting a business activity (dzia≈Çalno≈õƒá gospodarcza), it is necessary to obtain the appropriate permit. Also, in the case of purchasing a land plot, the procedure is significantly more complicated, which we will discuss shortly.
Financing the purchase
Bank loans:

Lending conditions vary depending on the bank, and usually require confirmation of stable income. Down payment: Usually, a down payment is required (20% of the property's value, or 10% of the value in some banks with the condition of purchasing additional insurance).
3. Legal aspects

Notarial processing: All transactions related to the purchase of real estate must be certified by a notary, who checks the documents and executes the agreement. Usually, the agreement consists of a preliminary contract (umowa przedwstƒôpna), which records the basic terms of the purchase and reserves the property, and later a main contract (umowa przyrzeczona) is signed, which finally secures the transfer of ownership. Taxes and expenses: When purchasing real estate, Ukrainian citizens must take into account the real estate transfer tax (2% of the value, if it is not the first home) and the costs of notarial services.
4. Document verification

Real estate audit: Before purchasing, it is important to check the legal status of the property with an extract from the land register (ksiƒôgi wieczyste) to learn about possible restrictions or encumbrances. Buying a home in Poland for Ukrainian citizens in 2024 has become more accessible due to simplified procedures. However, it is important to carefully study the market, consult with experts, and be prepared for the legal and financial obligations associated with purchasing real estate.

text_entities.TRANSLATED_TEXT: What can be done if your Ukrainian pension has stopped being paid from month to month while you are abroad?

‚úÖ Try contacting your (regional, district) office of the Pension Fund of Ukraine. Phone numbers are available online, and some of them can be called using communicators like Viber or WhatsApp. ‚úÖ During the conversation with the Pensions Fund of Ukraine employee, find out the reason for the suspension of payments. It is most often related to the fact that pensioners do not spend money credited to their bank accounts as part of their pensions over a long period (for example, several months) (do not use cards, do not withdraw cash from ATMs, etc.). As a result of receiving such information from the bank, the Pension Fund of Ukraine may change the method of pension payment from 'through a bank' to 'through the mail' - for obvious reasons, the postman will not find the pensioner at home, the monthly pension will return to the Pension Fund of Ukraine, and further pension payments will be suspended for following months.

text_entities.TRANSLATED_TEXT: In Poland, the campaign 'Feed a Dog with OLX' has started ‚Äì you can help dogs from shelters

From December 6 to 16, the annual 'Feed a Dog with OLX' campaign will take place in Poland. Participants can help dogs from shelters in Radlin and Tarnobrzeg by simply clicking on the website to add a portion of food for a specific dog. This is already the 17th initiative by the company aimed at supporting homeless animals. From December 9, those interested can also purchase charity certificates or make a monetary contribution. The campaign is accompanied by the 'Animal - Not a Gift' campaign, reminding people of the importance of a responsible approach to acquiring pets, especially during the pre-New Year period. OLX notes that in the 'Animals for Adoption' category on the platform, there are more than 34 thousand dogs and 20 thousand cats waiting for a new home.

Obtaining a residence card under a simplified procedure (so-called CUKR)
Important
According to the amendments to the Law on Assistance to Citizens of Ukraine, citizens of Ukraine who have a PESEL number with UKR status
will be able to obtain a temporary residence card through a simplified procedure (the so-called CUKR card).
As of today, the application procedure has not yet been developed. However, it is planned that applications for obtaining the CUKR card can only be submitted online through the electronic system.
The CUKR card will be issued for 3 years and will provide the right to work in Poland
without additional work permit. Also, the employer will not be obliged to notify the Employment Office about the employment of a citizen of Ukraine.

How to identify a pensioner online?

üîπ1.Enter 'Pension Fund of Ukraine Electronic Services Portal login' in your browser (Chrome, Mozilla, Microsoft Edge, Opera, Safari, etc.). üîπ2.Go to the website of the PFU electronic services portal and click 'Login'. üîπ3.The 'Log in to the system' page will open. Select the 'Diia.Signature' option. üîπ4.Select 'Get login code'. üîπ5.A page with a QR code will open. Open the 'Diia' application, click on 'Stream', and then on the scanner symbol. üîπ6.Scan the QR code that appears on the PFU electronic services portal website.
In the 'Diia' app, there are two options:

üì∑ A) A photo frame for video identification will open. üëâ Point it at your face and follow the app's instructions. ‚úÖ If everything is successful, you will see the message "Identity confirmed." üî¢ After that, a request to enter a 5-digit code for the "Diya Signature" function will appear. üëâ Enter the code, wait for the message "Confirmed" (in green), and click on it. üíª B) A request to enter a 5-digit code for the "Diya Signature" function will appear immediately, without video identification. üî¢ Enter the code, wait for confirmation, and click on it. üëâ From the page with the QR code on the PFU electronic services website, you will move to your personal pensioner cabinet. üìå If you want to verify the result of the identification, select the "My appeals" tab. It is easy to recognize which appeal interests you by the date, time, and category "Other." After selecting the appropriate appeal, go into the details. ‚úÖ If the identification was successful, the "Response" section will say "Assigned/Identified." üëâ P.S. If you have not activated the "Diya Signature" function in the "Diya" app, please review the activation instructions in a separate post. üü¢ If you have additional questions, contact our helpline at the number: ‚òé

Buying an apartment in Poland for Ukrainian citizens in 2024: key aspects

In 2024, citizens of Ukraine have the opportunity to purchase property in Poland, considering several important aspects. Let's look at the conditions and procedures that need to be known before making a decision.
Right to purchase
Availability for citizens of Ukraine: In 2024

However, if the property is to be used for economic activities (dzia≈Çalno≈õƒá gospodarcza), an appropriate permit must be obtained. Also, in the case of purchasing a plot of land, the procedure is significantly more complex, which we will discuss shortly.
2. Financing the purchase
Loans from banks:

Lending conditions vary depending on the bank and usually require proof of a stable income. Down payment: Generally, a down payment is required (20% of the property's value or 10% of the value at some banks, provided that additional insurance is purchased).
3. Legal aspects

Notarial procedure: All transactions related to real estate purchases must be formalized by a notary, who checks the documents and concludes the agreement. Usually, the agreement consists of a preliminary contract (umowa przedwstƒôpna), which fixes the main conditions of the purchase and reserves the property, and subsequently, the main contract (umowa przyrzeczona) is signed, which finally confirms the transfer of ownership rights. Taxes and expenses: When purchasing real estate, citizens of Ukraine should take into account the real estate transfer tax (2% of the value, if it is not the first residence) and notarial service expenses.
4. Document verification

Real estate audit: Before purchasing, it is important to check the legal status of the property using an extract from the land registry (ksiƒôgi wieczyste) to learn about possible restrictions or encumbrances. Buying a home in Poland for Ukrainian citizens in 2024 has become more accessible due to simplified procedures. However, it is important to thoroughly research the market, consult with specialists, and be prepared for the legal and financial obligations associated with buying property. üü¢ If you have additional questions, contact our helpline at the number: ‚òé

Termination of lease agreement.
Fixed-term contracts

Lease agreements for a fixed term, usually for a year, without the possibility of early termination are increasingly common. This means that the only way to terminate the contract early is to reach a mutual agreement between the tenant and the landlord.

However, no one is obligated to do this ‚Äî everything happens out of good will. ‚úã If an agreement could not be reached, the tenant is obligated to continue paying rent until the end of the contract, even if they no longer reside in the dwelling.
What happens if you don't pay?
The landlord may file a lawsuit to recover the debt.
‚è∞ Termination of the contract "effective at the end of the month"
üîé If the contract provides for the possibility of early termination with a certain notice period, it is important to know how this period is calculated. üëâ The phrase "
with effect at the end of the month

means that the termination will be effective at the end of the following calendar month. For example, if the tenant notifies the landlord in June, the month count starts on July 1st, and the agreement will terminate on July 31st.
Important!

Before signing the contract, always carefully read all its terms, especially the paragraph about contract termination (wypowiedzenie). If you have questions or doubts, contact the housing rental department consultants at the Ukrainian House. We are always ready to help and thoroughly analyze the agreement, warning about potential pitfalls.

Behind the bright lights lie fatigue, loneliness, or inner tension. It is important to listen to yourself and allow your emotions to "speak."

Christmas awakens memories - joyful and painful ones. It can remind us of those who are no longer here, or moments we want to forget. It's normal - holidays open a 'window' to the past. Give yourself time to live through these feelings.
Holidays are not only physical exertion but also psycho-emotional pressure: cooking, celebrating, being the perfect family member. Allow yourself to be tired, imperfect.
Sometimes loneliness feels sharper among people. If you are among loved ones but feel a distance, it's a signal. Ask yourself: "What do I want?"

We invite you to the training program for gestalt therapists (NAGTU/EAGT). The first-level training program is dedicated to acquainting you with the gestalt approach, as one of the directions of modern psychotherapy, acquiring basic knowledge and principles of the method and experience in personal and group psychotherapy. The program meets the standards of the European Association for Gestalt Therapy (EAGT) and consists of 180 educational and therapeutic hours (6 three-day modules, 30 academic hours each). First-level training is suitable for: psychologists, sociologists, psychotherapists, and students of corresponding specialties; those who wish to obtain a professional education in the gestalt direction; everyone who is interested in personal growth, increasing social competence and personal effectiveness; everyone who works with people and would like to improve the quality of communication (managers, educators, service sector workers, medical professionals, lawyers, HR specialists, etc.). The level 1 program will give you the opportunity to: Get acquainted with the basics of psychological counseling and gestalt therapy; Expand practical communication skills; Discover your desires and ways to fulfill them; Deal with complex relationships; Obtain methods of overcoming difficult challenges. Upon the completion of the first level, you will receive a certificate from the National Association of Gestalt Therapists of Ukraine, as well as the opportunity to continue training at the second level of professional gestalt therapist training. The program is registered on the NAGTU community website.

Buying an apartment in Poland for Ukrainian citizens in 2024: key aspects

In 2024, citizens of Ukraine have the opportunity to purchase real estate in Poland, taking into account several important aspects. Let's consider the conditions and procedures that need to be known before making a decision.
Right to purchase
Availability for Ukrainian citizens: In 2024

However, if the property will be used for conducting business activities (dzia≈Çalno≈õƒá gospodarcza), it is necessary to obtain the appropriate permit. Also, in the case of purchasing a plot of land, the procedure is much more complicated, which we will discuss shortly.
2. Financing the purchase
Loans from banks:

The lending terms vary depending on the bank and usually require confirmation of a stable income. Down payment: Usually, a down payment is required (20% of the property value or 10% in some banks if additional insurance is purchased).
3. Legal aspects

Notarial execution: All transactions related to property purchases must be executed with a notary, who checks the documents and drafts the agreement. Typically, the agreement consists of a preliminary contract (umowa przedwstƒôpna), which fixes the main terms of the purchase and reserves the property, and subsequently, a main contract (umowa przyrzeczona) is signed, which definitively secures the transfer of ownership rights. Taxes and expenses: When buying property, Ukrainian citizens must consider the real estate transfer tax (2% of the value if it's not the first home) and notarial service expenses.
4. Document verification

Real Estate Audit: Before purchasing, it is important to verify the legal status of the property by means of an extract from the land register (ksiƒôgi wieczyste) to find out about possible restrictions or encumbrances. Buying housing in Poland for citizens of Ukraine in 2024 has become more accessible due to simplified procedures. However, it is important to thoroughly study the market, consult with specialists, and be prepared for the legal and financial obligations involved in purchasing real estate.

Buying an apartment in Poland for Ukrainian citizens in 2024: key aspects

In 2024, citizens of Ukraine have the opportunity to purchase real estate in Poland, taking into account several important aspects. Let's look at the conditions and procedures to know before making a decision.
Right to purchase
Availability for citizens of Ukraine: In 2024

However, if the property is to be used for business activities (dzia≈Çalno≈õƒá gospodarcza), it is necessary to obtain the appropriate permission. Also, in the case of purchasing a plot of land, the procedure is much more complicated, which we will explain shortly.
2. Financing the purchase
Loans from banks:

Lending terms vary depending on the bank, and usually require proof of stable income. Initial contribution: An initial contribution (20% of the property value or 10% of the value in some banks if additional insurance is purchased) is usually required.
3. Legal aspects

Notarial execution: All transactions related to the purchase of real estate must be executed by a notary, who checks the documents and concludes the agreement. Typically, the agreement consists of a preliminary contract (umowa przedwstƒôpna), which sets out the main terms of purchase and reserves the property, and subsequently the main contract (umowa przyrzeczona) is signed, which finally secures the transfer of ownership rights. Taxes and expenses: When purchasing real estate, citizens of Ukraine must take into account the real estate transfer tax (2% of the value if it is not the first housing) and the costs of notarial services.
4. Document check
